titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Media Projects, Director, Andrea Taylor Correspondence
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Media Projects, Director, Andrea Taylor Correspondence FA1417
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-12 16:26:47 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Media Projects, Director, Andrea Taylor Correspondence

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Andrea Taylor founded Media Projects, a unit within Media, Arts, and Culture (MAC) at the Ford Foundation, in 1988, and she served as director of the program until 1997.

During Taylor's tenure at the Ford Foundation, she managed $50 million in support of global film, video, television, and radio projects, including Sesame Street in China and South Africa, television series such as Eyes on the Prize and The Pacific Century, and National Public Radio.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at https://rockarch.org/collections/access-and-request-materials/#citations

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into one series: Correspondence Files

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2018 by the Ford Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accession 2018:018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains Andrea Taylor's correspondence with grant applicants and inter-office memoranda from 1993-1996 when she served as Director of Media Projects at the Ford Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memo - Draft of FY 1994 and 1995 Program for Media Projects

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Delegated Authority Grants (DAG) to two radio series on reproductive health and population
